Ok, the new rocket, Esther 1 lifted off the pad at day 90, but was destroyed just after liftoff...photo of rocket just before it came apart at the seams are being developed presently

- - - Updated - - -

Pics of the program coming soon!

- - - Updated - - -

Here's the Seer 1 probe

Ok, as of day 120, Jebediah Kerman from the United Kerbin Union has successfully flown a Suborbital mission up to an altitude of 90 km at an inclination of 0 degrees. He then battered his way back into Kerbin's atmosphere at a scorching 500m/s and parachuted down into some nearby mountains. The Program is back on track from the disastrous loss of its Duna Impactor mission.

Pictures to come:

So basically you guys have you're first man and I have my first probe. We're looking good

Also if you want those really cool fuzzy pictures download hullcam vds
Ok, today's session is going to,start at some point after4:00 pm PST or when voyager and i are available. Newcomers, please remember, 3 launches per session, one every 30 days. Absolutely NO reverts.

Seer 2,4 and 5 will launch soon!!

Also, does anyone have suggestions for a Kerbin system mission? All seer missions up to seer 10 are booked besides seer 9, anyone have any ideas inside the Kerbin system?
Tristonwilson reporting for duty

Seer 2,4 and 5 will launch soon!!

Also, does anyone have suggestions for a Kerbin system mission? All seer missions up to seer 10 are booked besides seer 9, anyone have any ideas inside the Kerbin system?

I presently have a rocket poised to launch to duna

Btw, don't ask why I skipped Seer 3.

I can't tell you which mission, because it's classified, but one of the final seer missions will do a Duna flyby

And any suggestions for Seer 9?
Going to see the Martian today. May take some inspiration from that for a future mission
It was an awesome movie
The ground team is getting ready for Seer 2
Can I be the Kanadian Space Agency that never was?

Can I be the Kanadian Space Agency that never was?

Give me some time to chat with Voyager, I am considering, because of the massive amount of people, to make a small change... hang tight:

in the meantime, finally got a video up on youtube for my Bugseye 1 flight:

Traveler 3 became the first probe in interplanetary space.

Traveler 4 then flew by Duna becoming the first object to reach another planet.

- - - Updated - - -

Traveler 5 has been postponed until a rocket problem is fixed. Severe oscillations from the srb first stage almost ended Traveler 3 and 4.

don't feel like saying much at present time. Gotta go to bed. long story short, this was a mission tht was planned to land a robot lander on Minmus. Unfortunately, fate chose otherwise and the rocket came back down after booster jettison:

Seer 2, Seer TS, and Seer 4 have been postponed until Gene Tao Kerman gets back from an extended (2 day) coffee break

- - - Updated - - -

Also, I was asked what the name means and how to pronounce it: C-ehr
The rocket oscillations will take some time to fix(2 days). No launches will happen till then.

Ok, slight change, due to the influx of newcomers, i have decided that no person will represent an existing nation. Instead, they will represent the program of a,nation of their own creation. Before you begin, you will need to declare what way you will report your missions. One way, is to report only your successes. The other way , is to report both successes and failures. Again, 3 launches per session and each launch must be 30 kerbal days apart from the next.

Ok, new rules for,new people,wishing to join. We ask that you please pm either Voyager275 or myself of your intention to join. Those who have joined already are exempt from this rule. Also, we have decided to pair you off into a 1v1 races.
